此回覆已被刪除

PS fanboys need to calm down and stop drinking the Sony kool-aid for a second (which may be difficulty if you don't read western media).

Xbox One X has 70 4k-confirmed titles already. This includes new games like Anthem, Sea of Thieves, Monster Hunter World and Black Desert Online but also older games like DOOM, Witcher 3 and Skyrim.

People who say 4K isn't impressive, are people who don't use 4K. But if you don't want to upgrade to a 4k monitor, 1080p users will still benefit. For 1080p screens, the 4k image will be supersampled, providing those users with a perfect image quality that is free from aliasing.

At a system-level, there is 16x Antisoptric Filtering which will also improve backwards compatible games. So, 360 and Original Xbox games will run and look better all for free. The extra X1X horsepower will always be available and developers don't need to patch their games to make use of it.

So, games with unlocked framerates like GTA4 on 360 or Terrorist Hunt on Rainbow6 (when you turn v-sync off) are guaranteed to hit a consistent 60fps with no screen-tearing AND look better at the same time.

If you want to play RDR or any last-gen favourites, you can do it all for free on X1X without paying money for the PSnow service.

Microsoft don't force companies to use the power for 4k, either. Certain developers like Ark: Survival Evolved will instead make the game 1080p on X1X but run the game at 60FPS on PC's "epic" graphics settings.

We are all gamers, so MS want to break down the walls that separate us. That's why Xbox Live users will be able to sign in on the Nintendo Switch to play Minecraft cross platform. Gunscape will be cross platform with PC and Switch and Rocket League will be like that, too. Except Sony will be left out.

TL;DR? Stop being a bunch of fucking kids, fighting on a school playground and grow up. Give credit where credit is due and have a fun time gaming on whichever platform you prefer. I'll be having a lot of fun on my X1X in November.
